alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 12:41PM MDT until June 23 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Crowheart, Kinnear...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Wind River near Crowheart. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 9.5 feet, Very minor low land flooding begins. At 10.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor low land flooding becomes more widespread. Access road to gage begins to be covered with water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to slowly fall to around 9.0 feet through Thursday. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
